item.title: The Darwin Incident ‒ Episode 8
item.content:encoded: That's a lot of grousing I can do about these details in this episode, since so much of this week's entry is that sort of setup before the Lucy Kidnapping Arc presumably sees Lucy get kidnapped.

item.title: This Week in Anime - Stunt-Casting

item.title: Hell Teacher: Jigoku Sensei Nube ‒ Episode 21
item.content:encoded: The unknown and mysterious is often far more frightening than any number of daft-looking monsters.

item.title: The Girl Called Prince: How In the Clear Moonlit Dusk Asks Who Gets to Decide Your Gender Performance
item.content:encoded: The series asks how much of gender performance emerges as choice versus armor—what you build when the world insists certain ways of being remain unavailable to you.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Game Review
item.content:encoded: It may not be the best of the <i>Resident Evil</i> adventures to come out these last few years, but <i>Requiem</i> probably represents most <i>Resident Evil</i> experience that this new generation has cooked up so far.

item.title: Anime Fits Metal Like a Powerglove

item.title: In the Clear Moonlit Dusk ‒ Episodes 5-6
item.content:encoded: <i>In the Clear Moonlit Dusk</i> thus far has failed to live up to my expectations or hopes in any way.

item.title: Prime Video VP: 'We Want to Become Preferred Destination for Anime Content Globally'
item.content:encoded: Service previously announced it will stream upcoming <cite>The Ghost in the Shell</cite>, <cite>Hokuto no Ken -Fist of the North Star-</cite>, 2nd season <cite>From Old Country Bumpkin to Master Swordsman</cite> anime

item.title: Oshi no Ko Season 3 ‒ Episode 6
item.content:encoded: It was supremely rewarding to see Kana gather her courage and become her own savior.

item.title: 'In So Deep, It's Love Already' Manga Ends in 10th Volume
item.content:encoded: Manga about idol fangirl, mysterious transfer student launched in 2022
